channel.title: Teaching News@Emory
channel.description: All the latest news from Emory University.

item.title: New Health Course Shifts to Peer-Led, Personalized Approach
item.description: "Health 100: It's Your Health" promotes a personalized approach to healthy living for freshmen, who are mentored by peer health partners. The new course is just one component of Emory's strategic shift in health education, rooted in the predictive health research being conducted on campus.

item.title: Music and Worship Certificate Now Offered by Emory's Candler School of Theology
item.description: Emory University's Candler School of Theology is offering a new Certificate in Music and Worship, providing worship and music leaders the opportunity to study closely with the esteemed theologians and musicians on Candler's faculty.

item.title: NIH Awards Blueprint Training Grant in Computational Neuroscience
item.description: Faculty at Emory and Georgia Tech are training young scientists in how to use the tools of biomedical computation to solve challenging problems of neuroscience with a new five-year grant of $1.6 million from the National Institutes of Health.

item.title: Emory Law's Turner Environmental Law Clinic Receives $40,000 Grant
item.description: The Turner Environmental Law Clinic has received a $40,000 Turner Foundation grant to support the clinic's pro bono work and programs that provide real-world experience to student attorneys.

item.title: Rushdie Named to New Position at Emory
item.description: Acclaimed author Salman Rushdie will continue his affiliation with Emory University with a new title, as University Distinguished Professor, reflecting more expansive activities, according to an announcement by University Provost Earl Lewis.

item.title: CNN, Emory's James Weldon Johnson Institute and National Center for Civil and Human Rights Join to Launch Forum Series
item.description: CNN, the James Weldon Johnson Institute for the Study of Race and Difference at Emory University and the National Center for Civil and Human Rights have joined together to launch CNN Dialogues, a series of public discussions featuring prominent figures debating the major issues that define our times.

item.title: Genetic Counseling Masters Degree Program Launched at Emory School of Medicine
item.description: Emory University School of Medicine is launching a new Academic Health Professions Program in Genetic Counseling. The two-year program, housed in the Department of Human Genetics, combines cutting-edge coursework with multiple and varied clinical experiences.

item.title: Civil Rights History Interpreted Through Lenses of Student Travelers
item.description: This summer, nine Oxford College students took a tour of places of importance to the American civil rights movement. Starting in Americus, Ga., the students traveled through Alabama and Mississippi, concluding their tour in Memphis.

item.title: Parenting a College Student: What To Expect
item.description: Emory University psychology professor Marshall Duke has helped ease the separation process for parents and their newly minted college students with a tremendously popular Emory orientation seminar on "Parenting a College Student: What To Expect."

item.title: Candler School of Theology, General Theological Seminary Form Partnership
item.description: Emory UniversityÂ¿s Candler School of Theology in Atlanta and The General Theological Seminary in New York are entering an innovative partnership that includes the sharing of library resources, collaborative educational programs and the exchange of both students and faculty members.

item.title: Emory Remains Among Top Ten 'Teach for America' Contributors
item.description: Emory University students are well represented among the 2011 Teach for America corps. Emory is 10th nationally among medium sized universities contributing the greatest number of recent graduates.

item.title: CNN, Emory's James Weldon Johnson Institute and National Center for Civil and Human Rights Join to Launch Forum Series
item.description: CNN, the James Weldon Johnson Institute for the Study of Race and Difference at Emory University and the National Center for Civil and Human Rights have joined together to launch CNN Dialogues, a series of public discussions featuring prominent figures debating the major issues that define our times.

item.title: What Motivates Professors to Teach Pre-College Students?
item.description: A hallmark of the Pre-College Program is the participation of some of Emory's best senior faculty. Find out why they do it.

item.title: Emory Announces Name Change for Continuing Education Division
item.description: Emory University recently unveiled the name change for its continuing education division. The former division, Emory's Center for Lifelong Learning, has been rebranded as Emory Continuing Education.

item.title: Doctorate's ORDER: Teach Your Research
item.description: In ORDER courses, graduate student instructors collaborate across their disciplines to provide specific insight into how to conduct a project, walking the younger students step-by-step through their own research efforts.
